unnormalised: The tourism sector in Kerala is slowly recovering post-monsoon, but travelers are feeling the pinch of rising costs. A recent survey indicates that the average daily expenditure for a tourist, excluding flight tickets, has jumped by approximately 15% compared to last year. This is largely attributed to increased prices in accommodation and local transport. For example, a standard houseboat stay in Alleppey now costs around Rs. 8000 per night, up from Rs. 6500 in 2023.

unnormalised: Local auto-rickshaw fares have also seen a hike, with short trips within cities now costing upwards of ₹100. Even a simple meal at a tourist-friendly restaurant can easily set one back by Rs 500 per person. Tour operators are suggesting travelers budget an additional $50 per day to comfortably enjoy their Kerala experience.
